title: Compressed Air Treatment Path
description: Interactive flow diagram showing compressed air moving through each treatment stage — aftercooler, receiver, pre-filter, dryer, and after-filter — with contaminant levels displayed at each point. Students can toggle dryer type and adjust ambient humidity to see how each component improves air quality.
creator: Peter Vinck
subject: Compressed Air Systems
Air Treatment
Industrial Utilities
Fluid Power Systems
prerequisites: Basic understanding of compressed air systems
Familiarity with pressure and temperature concepts

controls.label: Refrigerated Dryer / Desiccant Dryer
controls.description: Toggles between refrigerated and desiccant dryer types to compare dew point performance

controls.label: Ambient Humidity
controls.description: Adjusts ambient humidity to see how inlet moisture affects treatment load
